objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: Infrastructure-level hijack of Notepad++
objects.description: State-sponsored group Lotus Blossom compromised the official Notepad++ hosting infrastructure to redirect update traffic and serve malicious update manifests to specific targets in SE Asia and the West.

objects.content:
Sector: Government, Telecommunications, Critical Infrastructure, Cloud hosting

Modus operandi:
Infrastructure hijacking, DLL side-loading (using Bitdefender component), Lua script injection, custom backdoors (Chrysalis).

objects.name: VoidLink Framework Deployment
objects.description: A new Chinese-speaking threat actor leveraging a modular 'compile-on-demand' framework named VoidLink to target Linux systems, using AI-enabled IDEs for rapid development.

objects.content:
Sector: Technology, Financial Services

Modus operandi:
ZigLang implants, C plugins, eBPF/LKM rootkits, AI-assisted development, RBAC-enabled C2.

objects.name: CVE-2026-1281
objects.description:
Pre-authentication code injection vulnerability in Bash handler allowing remote code execution. Massive exploitation surge observed (28.3k IPs).

Affected product: Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM)

Affected vendor: Ivanti

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:ivanti:endpoint_manager_mobile:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-20700
objects.description:
Zero-day vulnerability in dyld (Dynamic Link Editor) exploited in sophisticated targeted attacks to execute arbitrary code.

Affected product: iOS, macOS, iPadOS

Affected vendor: Apple

CPE: cpe:2.3:o:apple:iphone_os:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-20841
objects.description:
Remote code execution flaw via malicious Markdown links in Notepad. Launching unverified protocols without warning.

Affected product: Windows 11 Notepad App

Affected vendor: Microsoft

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:microsoft:notepad:*

objects.name: Breach: Volvo Group North America
objects.description:
Data of nearly 17,000 employees exposed following a massive breach at business service provider Conduent, affecting a total of 25 million people across various states.

Sector: Automotive / Manufacturing

objects.name: Breach: Microsoft Account Users (4,000+)
objects.description:
Hijacking of the 'AgreeTo' Outlook add-in on the official Microsoft Store. Attackers used abandoned URLs to plant phishing kits and steal credentials and credit card numbers.

Sector: Multi-sector (Outlook Users)

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / US-Canada Diplomatic Friction & Separatism
objects.content:
Sector: Government / Sovereignty

Theme: US-Canada Diplomatic Friction & Separatism

Analysis of the Trump administration's alleged support for Albertan separatism (Alberta Prosperity Project) as a tool to pressure the Canadian federal government and secure energy resources.

Tags: Trump, Canada, Energy, Alberta

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / Kremlin War Propaganda in Video Games
objects.content:
Sector: Media / Entertainment

Theme: Kremlin War Propaganda in Video Games

The Russian state is increasingly funding 'patriotic' video games to shape narratives among younger demographics and bypass traditional media critical thinking.

Tags: Propaganda, Russia, Video Games, Influence

objects.name: LummaStealer and CastleLoader Resurgence
objects.description:
Surge in LummaStealer (LummaC2) activity despite 2025 disruption. Delivered via CastleLoader using 'ClickFix' fake CAPTCHA social engineering.

Analysis:
Lumma has successfully migrated to bulletproof hosting providers. The 'ClickFix' technique tricks users into running PowerShell commands from the clipboard, bypassing technical detections by exploiting human error.

Recommendations:
- Disable PowerShell execution for standard users and monitor clipboard-to-shell activities.
- Implement blocklists for the identified C2 infrastructure and monitor for failed DNS lookups to non-existent domains.

objects.name: SSHStalker Linux Botnet
objects.description:
IRC-based botnet targeting Linux servers using legacy kernel exploits and mass SSH scanning. Maintains 'dormant persistence'.

Analysis:
The botnet targets 2.6.x kernels still present in legacy enterprise environments and OT systems. It compiles malware directly on-host to evade file-based signatures.

Recommendations:
- Enforce MFA for all SSH access and disable legacy Linux kernel support where possible.

objects.content: The threat landscape for early 2026 is characterized by three major trends: the professionalization of 'Vibecoding' (AI-generated malware), sophisticated supply chain attacks targeting core administrative tools (Notepad++, Microsoft Store add-ins), and the industrialization of Information Stealers (LummaStealer/CastleLoader). We observe a critical surge in the exploitation of Ivanti EPMM (CVE-2026-1281) and Apple zero-days (CVE-2026-20700), indicating a focus on high-value infrastructure. Geopolitically, the use of video games for state-sponsored propaganda and the weaponization of trade/separatist movements (Alberta) highlight the blending of cyber operations with psychological warfare.
